page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: In this area the dairy farmer is geared to milking twice daily each day of the year.The morning milking session beginning at approximately 6.30pm:the afternoon session at about 4pm. As in most of the British Isles, the 'herringbone' milking parlour is the most popular with local farmers. This system was first introduced into this country from New Zealand in 1956. It is particularly suitable for farms which have milking herds of between 50 -300 cows. The herds comprising of mainly British Friesian or a Friesian - Holstein cross produce on average 5000 litres per cow per annum.The British Holstein is in the eyes of many local farmers becoming the highest yielding and fastest growing British dairy breed.
